snippet: A group of American scientists have been studying how to replicate properties found in certain types of bean leaves that can capture, or at least slow down, the pests.
abstract: Study published in Journal of Royal Society Interface validates traditional use of bean leaves to trap and kill bed bugs, finding that synthetic alternatives are not as effective.
lead_paragraph: A group of American scientists have been studying how to replicate properties found in certain types of bean leaves that can capture, or at least slow down, the pests.

headline.seo: How a Leafy Folk Remedy Stopped Bedbugs in Their Tracks
headline.main: How a Leafy Folk Remedy Stopped Bedbugs in Their Tracks
headline.print_headline: How a Leafy Folk Remedy Stopped Bedbugs in Their Tracks
